info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 10:12PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Lee, Phillips, DeSoto, central Coahoma, Marshall, Tate, northwestern Tishomingo, northern Quitman, Alcorn, Panola, northern Lafayette, Tunica, Tippah, Benton, southern Hardeman, Hardin and McNairy Counties through 1045 PM CDT... At 1010 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Savannah to near Marianna to near Watkins Corner. Movement was south at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Southaven, Olive Branch, Clarksdale, Corinth, Hernando, Senatobia, Holly Springs, Batesville, Savannah, Ripley, Selmer, Marvell, Elaine, Wall Doxey State Park, John W Kyle State Park, Pickwick Landing State Park, J P Coleman State Park, St Francis National Park, Helena-West Helena and White River National Wildlife Refuge. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for eastern Arkansas...northwestern Mississippi...and west Tennessee.
